New Records: The Orlando Magic broke a five-game losing streak
Key Match Events: Mo Wagner added 17 points for Orlando
Brandon Boston Jr. had 26 points for New Orleans
Jose Alvarado added 21 points, five rebounds and five assists
Jalen Suggs' 3-pointer with 8:36 left in the third quarter ended a stretch of more than nine minutes in which the Magic did not make a field goal
Boston and Alvarado combined for 15 points on a 17-1 Pelicans run that cut it to 10
Pre-Game Insights: New Orleans was missing six of its top eight scorers due to injuries, including Zion Williamson
The Magic were looking to end a five-game losing streak
Post-Match Reflections: The Magic won for the 10th straight time at home, going back to March 30 and including the postseason
They are 2-14 on the road in that span
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Magic took a 24-point lead in the first 18 minutes
They converted six dunks, six layups and four 3-pointers
The Magic survived a long cold stretch and 8-for-32 3-point shooting
Others: The Pelicans return home to face Brooklyn on Monday night
The Magic host Washington on Sunday night
